de.systemagmbh.tools.io
Class CSysDiaryFileWriter

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.io.CSysDiaryFileWriter
public final class CSysDiaryFileWriter
extends Object

Customer - Requirement: They want to log Strings to a daily file. The names of the daily file are defined by a SimpleDate format pattern.

Version:
$Revision: 1.6 $
Author:
Herbert Helmstreit, Udo Friedrich

Constructor Summary

          Create a CSysDiaryFileWriter leaving all settings at their default value.

          Create a CSysDiaryFileWriter.

Constructor Detail

CSysDiaryFileWriter

public CSysDiaryFileWriter()
Create a CSysDiaryFileWriter leaving all settings at their default value.
pattern The simpledate format pattern used to generate the file. default: "yyyy-MM-dd"
extension The fileextension of the files generated. default: ".log"
prefix The filenameprefix of the files generated; May not contain a directory. default: ""

CSysDiaryFileWriter

public CSysDiaryFileWriter(String pattern,
                           String extension,
                           String prefix)
Create a CSysDiaryFileWriter.

Parameters:
pattern - The simpledate format pattern used to generate the file. If 'null' default ('yyyy-MM-dd') is used.
extension - The file extension of the files generated. If 'null' default ('.log') is used.
prefix - The file name prefix of the files generated; May contain directories now. If 'null' default (empty text) is used.
Method Detail

writeDiaryEntry

public void writeDiaryEntry(String message)
                     throws IOException
Append a line of text to the diary file. The current time is used to determine the file.

Parameters:
message - The line of text to write.
Throws:
IOException - on any write error.

writeDiaryEntry

public void writeDiaryEntry(Date timestamp,
                            String message)
                     throws IOException
Append a line of text to the diary file denoted by timestamp.

Parameters:
timestamp - The diaryfile to write the text to.
message - The line of text to write.
Throws:
IOException - on any write error.

writeToDiary

public void writeToDiary(Date timestamp,
                         String message)
Deprecated. because it does catch IOException. Use writeDiaryEntry instead.

Append a line of text to the diary file denoted by timestamp.
IMPORTANT NOTE:
In case of an IO exception nothing is written.

Parameters:
timestamp - The diaryfile to write the text to.
message - The line of text to write.

writeToDiary

public void writeToDiary(String message)
Deprecated. because it does catch IOException. Use writeDiaryEntry instead.

Append a line of text to the diary file. The current time is used to determine the file.
IMPORTANT NOTE:
In case of an IO exception nothing is written.

Parameters:
message - The line of text to write.

getCurrentFile

public File getCurrentFile()
Get the actual file.

IMPORTANT NOTE:
Do ONLY READ operations to the returned File, NO WRITE or RENAMING operations.

Returns:
the currently used file.

close

public void close()
This will close the file writer and set it to null.
